title: DATS dataset distribution schema
description: (From DCAT) Represents a specific available form of a dataset. Each dataset might be available in different forms, these forms might represent different formats of the dataset or different endpoints. Examples of distributions include a downloadable CSV file, an API or an RSS feed.

name.description: the name of the dimension measured or observed during the data acquisition process (e.g. signal intensity, standard deviation), ideally from a controlled terminology

type.description: a term, ideally from a controlled terminology, identifying the nature of the dimension, placing it in a typology

size.description: a property used to specify the size of the dataset.

unit.description: The unit of measurement used to estimate the size of the dataset (e.g, petabyte). Ideally, unit should be coming from a reference controlled terminology.

accessModalities.description: The information about access modality for the dataset.

version.description: an optional property used to specify a release point for the repository when applicable

storedIn.description: a property used to specify the data repository(ies) hosting the dataset.

conformsTo.description: a property used to specify the data standard whose requirements and constraints are met by the dataset.

date_info.description: Relevant dates for the datasets, at a minimum, creation date needs to be added
